com.xceptance.xlt.common.util.action.validation

Class XPathWithNonParseableWebResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.common.util.action.validation.XPathWithNonParseableWebResponse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XPathGetable

    public class XPathWithNonParseableWebResponse
extends java.lang.Object
implements XPathGetable

    Implementation of XPathGetable.
    The class is intended to offer ways to select elements by passing a xpath for WebReponse objects, whose body can NOT be parsed into a HtmlPage. E.g, XML or JSON content.

    In this case it is tried to offer alternative parsing possibilities to allow the selection of elements by xpath. If this is also not possible and it is tried to select elements by xpah, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.

    • Parses WebResponse only if the mime-type is supported (see supported types).
    • Use #isXPathable(mime-type) to see if a response is parsable.
    • Parses automatically and only when needed via getByXPath(String).
    • If the content of a WebResponse is not parsable, but the method getByXPath(String) is not calles, nothing happens.
    Author:
    matthias mitterreiter

    • Method Detail

      • getByXPath

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getByXPath(java.lang.String xPath)
        Parses the WebResponse in a format that allows to select elements by xpath, but only if necessary and only once.
        The elements then get parsed to Strings
        Specified by:
        getByXPath in interface XPathGetable
        Returns:
        list of all the selected elements in String representation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if it is not possible to parse and select.

      • isXPathable

        public boolean isXPathable(java.lang.String contentType)
        Parameters:
        contentType - mime-type of the WebResponse
        Returns:
        true only if the content can be parsed so that elements can be selected by xpath.
